titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edward Davison Papers
titlestmt.author: Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 03:06

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into nine series: I. Correspondence, 1920-1967. II. Military files, 1942-1950. III. Writings, 1914-1953. IV. Administrative Files, 1940-1949. V. Photographs, 1918-1962. VI. Personal Papers, 1920-1951. VII. Artwork, 1940-1959. VIII. Printed Material, 1919-1959. IX. Subject Files, 1919-1960.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Edward Davison Papers consist of correspondence, subject files, writings, photographs, personal papers, and printed material that document the military and literary careers of Edward Davison. Significant quantities of material relate to Davison's work with the Army Prisoners of War Special Projects Division. Davison oversaw the re-education of German prisoners of war who were brought to the United States during the Second World War. Other material relates to Davison's literary and academic work, particularly to the Writers' Conference and to the faculty of the University of Colorado, where Davison taught.

bioghist.head: Edward Davison (1898-1970)
bioghist.p: Edward Davison (1898-1970), Scottish-born American poet, professor at the University of Colorado, and director of the United States Army Prisoner of War Special Projects Division.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a basic level of processing in 2013, including rehousing and minimal organization. Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.
Former call number: Uncat Za MS 369

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Office of the Provost Marshal General

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Incoming, Outgoing, and Third Party.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence is chiefly professional in nature, relating to Davison's military career and to his literary activity.

did.unittitle: Holme, Peter H. and Jamie S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Military Files relate chiefly to Edward Davison's role as Director of the Prisoners of War Special Projects Division and include reports, subject files, and correspondence that document the re-education of German citizens in the United States following the Second World War. The series also includes documentation of personnel matters relating to Davison's military career.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Not arranged in any particular order.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Writings of Edward Davison, Writings of George Norlin, and Writings of Others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Writings series contains drafts of poems, music, and prose by Davison and by others, including a significant quantity of material by George Norlin, president of the University of Colorado from 1917 to 1942.

arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: University of Colorado, Washington and Jefferson University, and The Writers' Conference.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs include portraits and snapshots, with subjects ranging from poets and authors to personnel and prisoners of the Fort Kearney Prisoner of War Camp. Images of Edward Davison include formal portraits and family snapshots. Most subjects are identified on the verso of photographic prints.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by subject. Group photographs and unidentified photographs are filed at the end.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Military Publications, and Clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed material includes a substantial quantity of Army publications from the Second World War, including pamphlets and guides printed for army personnel, and publications of the Prisoner of War Special Projects Division.
